page.title: 19Historic buildings
page.content: Glastonbury boasts some interesting historic buildings. The most well known and most frequently visited are the{Abbey Ruins. The Abbot's Kitchen is the most complete building left within the Abbey grounds. The Abbey first stood on the site of a church,which according to legend was built by{Joseph of Arimathea}and his followers, of wattle and daub. It was dedicated to the Virgin Mary. Later on the same spot the Lady Chapel of the Abbey was built. It is believed the building of the Abbey was begun around 1184. It was the main centre of learning in Southern England. An immensely wealthy foundation, it was one of the last Abbeys to be destroyed by{Henry V111 in 1539.}At the East end of the Abbey was the{Edgar Chapel built by Abbots Beere and Whiting for the tomb of Edgar, a Saxon king.
